Description: Fragment of a flat bone strip, rectangular in shape, broken off at one end. Object card shows that the object was much longer and was perforated at both ends, like a spacer-bead, only half is preserved now. The upper part is well-smoothed and even, while the sides and the rear are only roughly smoothed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E12.3, between levels 1-2
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 173)
